column4: so can anyone tell me how to roll back a kernel update? I need to install my nvidia driver, and I can't because I would need kernel-sources, which neither Synaptic nor apt-get can find
foug- you can if you've set up your hard drive to use LVM, which I always recommend
foug- if you set it up yourself, and you don't know, you probably don't have LVM
robdig- ah, I DO have more options in my bootloader now.. wasn't sure what that was.. thansk
chuy- what type of partition is it?
/msg NickServ IDENTIFY
NTFS http://img2.freeimagehosting.net/image.php?cbbb475891.png sorry about the Identify... that was something else.
Here: http://img2.freeimagehosting.net/image.php?e3c6366649.png WTH?

Ok, I formatted the troublemaking harddrive to ext3. Now, I would like to mount it. When I type in "sudo mount -t ntsf-3g /dev/sdb1 /media/Spidora -o force" I get "mount: unknown filesystem type 'ntsf-3g'".
Ok, when I entered "sudo mount -t /dev/sdb1 /media/Spidora -o force" this is what I got: http://pastebin.com/m67d8fbf2
If the harddrive is /dev/hdb, do I use sdb1?
I still get the same messge
Now I'm getting the "mount: you must specify the filesystem type" message
Here: http://img510.imageshack.us/my.php?image=leepooballsil5.png
Ok, Spidora now has something named Lost+Found in it, but I can't open it. What is this?
No error...
No, It seems the permissions are all screwed up. How can I change this?
done.
/dev/hdb1 /media/Spidora ext3 defaults,locale=en_US.UTF-8 0 0 Right?
What do you mean "defaults"?
So my line should be correct?
